sourcesContent:
Customers

CustomerId Firstname Lastname Email Phone_Number Country_code Gender Balance
{{ customer.id }} {{ customer.firstname }} {{ customer.lastname }} {{ customer.email }} {{ customer.phone_Number }} {{ customer.country_code }} {{ customer.gender }} {{ customer.balance | currency }}

Add New Customer

import { HttpClient } from '@angular/common/http'; import { Component, OnInit, Inject } from '@angular/core'; @Component({ selector: 'app-customer', templateUrl: './customer.component.html', styleUrls: ['./customer.component.css'] }) export class CustomerComponent implements OnInit { customers: Customer[] = []; // Define the customer array base: string = ""; newCustomer: Customer = { id: '', firstname: '', lastname: '', email: '', phone_Number: '', country_code: '', gender: '', balance: 0 }; // Define a newCustomer object for adding editingCustomer: Customer = { id: '', firstname: '', lastname: '', email: '', phone_Number: '', country_code: '', gender: '', balance: 0 }; // Define a editingCustomer object for editing /* constructor(private http: HttpClient) { }*/ constructor(private http: HttpClient, @Inject('BASE_URL') baseUrl: string) { http.get(baseUrl + 'Customer/Customers').subscribe((data) => { this.customers = data; console.log(data); this.base = baseUrl; }, error => console.error(error)); } ngOnInit(): void { // Fetch the list of customers when the component is initialized this.getCustomers(); } getCustomers(): void { // Make an HTTP GET request to retrieve the list of customers this.http.get('Customer/Customers').subscribe((data) => { this.customers = data; }); } addCustomer(): void { // Make an HTTP POST request to add a new customer this.http.post('Customer/CreateCustomer', this.newCustomer).subscribe(() => { // Refresh the list of customers after adding this.getCustomers(); // Clear the new customer object this.newCustomer = { id: '', firstname: '', lastname: '', email: '', phone_Number: '', country_code: '', gender: '', balance: 0 }; }); } deleteCustomer(customerId: string): void { // Make an HTTP DELETE request to delete the customer this.http.delete(this.base + `Customer/DeleteCustomer/${customerId}`).subscribe(() => { // Refresh the list of customers after deletion this.getCustomers(); }); } } interface Customer { id: string; firstname: string; lastname: string; email: string; phone_Number: string; country_code: string; gender: string; balance: number; }
